> [ssdifnskdjfnsdjk](#comment_1_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS): Hi, this is what i am missing so far: [...]


> => community moderation of the talk to prevent case the site gets overspammed when admin die/abandon site
>  => downvotes / flag as a spam option. Topics flagged Too many times will disappear from public until site admin/moderators will put them back or delete permanently. such topic can no longer be put for moderation unless author will modify it.

There are problems with these. With this system, currently a user can create an unlimited amount of id's to wrongfully downvote (or upvote) / report/flag a post on all of the ids.

> => auto increase users limit of published content (USED: x/20K) by lets say 1K every day to prevent reaching limit on admin abandoned sites in future

This would require a server running full time, which is doable (since there are two bots on ZeroTalk that do this), but if that server goes offline, this function would no longer work anymore.

> [ssdifnskdjfnsdjk](#comment_18_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS): i see. But if the vote system can be abused, i think same apply on standard commenting system which can be abused for spam or make site unusable by spam flood from many ids created from one machine. In that case some antibot/user reputation system may be needed: https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/issues/1310

One way in which Nofish is going to improve the id situation is by adding a way for users to create a key with a prefix that takes over a day for your computer to compute (I think it's called proof of work?). There's also muting users.

Here's the issue for proof of work id's on GitHub: [https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/issues/1258](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/issues/1258)

However, I would say the abuse of downvoting and upvoting is worse than spam comments because downvoting and upvoting prioritizes posts over others or makes posts not visible, while spamming doesn't really do this all that much. Spamming doesn't really change the order of the posts and the visibility (to a certain extent).
